full_text: sgl ita 2017/KER/49566 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA THURSDAY, THE 7TH DAY OF DECEMBER 2017/16TH AGRAHAYANA, 1939 Cr1.MC.No. 8150 of 2017 () LP 40/2016 of ADDL.C.J.M. (E&O), ERNAKULAM PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED: FRANCIS JOSEPH AGED 36 YEARS, S/O.JOSEPH, EDATHIL HOUSE, PIZHALA DESOM, KADAMAKKUDY VILLAGE, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT. BY ADVS.SRI.S.RAJEEV SRI .K.K.DHEERENDRAKRISHNAN SRI.V.VINAY SRI .D.FEROZE RESPONDENT (S) /STATE/ DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031, (CRIME NO.2020/2011 OF E.T.SOUTH POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT) . 2. SUNIL KUMAR AGED 45 YEARS, S/O.RAMAKRISHNAN, EDANATTU VEEDU, NEAR MATTAL BHAGAWATHY TEMPLE, KADAVANTHRA, ELAMKULAM VILLAGE, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT, 682016. R2 BY ADV. SRI.VINOD KUMAR.C R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.C.S.HRITWICK THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 07-12-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: sgl ns nae ites 2017/KER/49566 Cr1.MC.No. 8150 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE-TI: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.2020/11 REGISTERED BY E.T.SOUTH POLICE STATION, NOW PENDING AS LP NO.40/2016. ANNEXURE-ITI: AFFIDAVIT DATED 21.11.2017 SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT/DEFACTO COMPALINANT. RESPONDENT'S EXHIBITS: NIL TRUE COPY PA TO JUDGE Scl. 2017/KER/49566 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 7 day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioner is the accused in L.P.No.40 of 2016 of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court (Economic Offences), Ernakulam, which is arising out of Crime No.2020 of 2011 of E.T.South Police Station, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 283, 323, 294 (b) of the Indian Penal Code. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. 4. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioner. The second respondent has filed Annexure-II affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioner and he has no complaints against the petitioner. apa 2017/KER/49566 Cril.M.C. No.8150 of 2017 -~2- Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled amicably between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case. Matters being so, all further proceedings in L.P.No.40 of 2016 of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court (Economic Offences), Ernakulam, which is arising out of Crime No.2020 of 2011 of E.T.South Police Station, against the petitioner, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings in L.P.No.40 of 2016 of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court (Economic Offences), Ernakulam, which is arising out of Crime No.2020 of 2011 of E.T.South Police Station, against the petitioner, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE Scl/07.12.2017
